summary: This is an evidence custody document from the Federal Bureau of Prisons detailing the seizure and chain of custody for a CPAP machine belonging to Jeffrey Epstein. The document records the machine's recovery from Epstein's cell on August 12, 2019, shortly after his death, and its transfer to the Special Investigative Services (SIS) office.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffery
persons.context: The CPAP machine was seized from his cell location (9 South 206-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He is listed as the suspect from whom the property was seized.

events.title: Seizure of CPAP machine from Epstein's cell
events.description: A CPAP machine was recovered as evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's cell (location 9 South 206-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 12:55 PM.

events.title: Transfer of evidence to SIS Office
events.description: The seized CPAP machine was released and transferred to the Special Investigative Services (SIS) office at 1:10 PM on the same day it was recovered.

locations: 9 South 206-220 - LAD (Epstein's cell location at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
SIS Office (Special Investigative Services office within the Bureau of Prisons)
keyFacts: A CPAP machine was seized from Jeffrey Epstein's prison cell on August 12, 2019, at 12:55 PM.
The evidence was recovered shortly after Epstein's death, indicating it was part of the post-mortem investigation.
The document shows a formal chain of custody procedure, with the evidence transferred to the Special Investigative Services (SIS) office within 15 minutes of recovery.
The document is part of case NYM-19-0180 / NYM-19-00200, related to the investigation into Epstein's death.
The evidence was marked for 'Hold as evidence' and potential 'Lab Analysis', suggesting it was examined as part of the death investigation.
